title: Celso and Cora
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Philippines - Social life and customs
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Family - Asia
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Children - Philippines
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Philippines - Social conditions
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Manila (Philippines) - Social conditions
description: A film in the mode of direct cinema which follows the lives, over a three month period, of a young couple and their two children living in a squatter settlement in Manila. A succession of long "takes" is edited as fragments in the lives of the subjects. Begins with Cora's attempt to find a new room for the family after they have been evicted from the previous home. Lately Celso and Cora face a crisis in their own relationship aggravated by the stresses of their daily life. Made by Gary Kildea with the local collaboration of Rowena Katalingkasan. Tagalog (Filipino) dialogue, English subtitles.
